Package entities

Class Creature

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
      • entities.Creature
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Human, Player
    public abstract class Creature
extends Entity
    Creature is the abstract class that is an extended class of the abstract class Entity. The creature class is used for collision detections with Tiles.

      Creature​(Handler handler, float x, float y, int width, int height)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Creature

        public Creature​(Handler handler,
                float x,
                float y,
                int width,
                int height)
        The Creature has default health and speed, this can be changed when creating a creature object. In the constructor it has a also health and speed, which are both initialized as a default final static
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler method from the superClass Entity
        x - the x position of the creature
        y - the y position of the creature
        width - the width in px
        height - the height in px

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        The move method of the player class this method runs 2 methods moveX() and moveY()

      • moveX

        public void moveX()
        The moveX method of the player checks the collision detection with the creature and a solid Tile A tile can be solid in the it's own Tile class. it uses the bounds Rectangle variable of the Entity superclass as collision box In this method we only check moving left and right.

      • moveY

        public void moveY()
        The moveY method of the player checks the collision detection with the creature and a solid Tile A tile can be solid in the it's own Tile class. it uses the bounds Rectangle variable of the Entity superclass as collision box In this method we only check moving up and down.

      • collisionWithTile

        protected boolean collisionWithTile​(int x,
                                    int y)
        the collisionWithTile is now only used in the moveX and moveY method. this method goes to the specific Tile that's on X and Y and checks if it's Solid or not. isSolid() = True // collision isSolid() = False // no collision
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the tile, which is most likely an entities x position, to collision
        y - the y position of the tile, which is most likely an entities y position, to collision
        Returns:
        a boolean, the same boolean as isSolid()
        See Also:
        isSolid() method, this can be overwritten in the subclasses for specified tiles
